content.description:
This one may be an all-time low. It may not get much tighter than this folks. If you thought sliding under the overhang for "Dab Control" was a bit much, you're going to be awestruck when you see this one.

 Sit-start matched on a nice aesthetic zig-zagging rail on the steep 60 degree overhang. Figure out a way the positioning to pull on and make a hard unwind to a good hold found on the left arete/ lip of the roof. Stay tight and match the lip before continuing up a few more moves to top out at the apex where another arete comes down to meet the lip.

 This problem suffers from a large slab behind it, but if that slab wasn't there, this climb would have had potential for one of the best that the Black Jacks have to offer.
content.protection: No pads or a blubber pad.
content.location:
Finding and accessing this problem is tricky by itself. The easiest way to find this problem is to approach it from the Entrance Boulders. Find "Bobby's Problem" spin around and find the overhang with the climb "Mr. Crawley". This is a short overhang that faces the trail and is about 15-20 yards above "Bobby's Problem".

 Now, from "Mr. Crawley",  climb up the jugs to stand on top. Once standing on top, one will see that The Rift Boulder is cleanly sheared at this location. There is a steep overhang that juts out over a slab, both the slab and the overhang are at nearly 60 degrees. "Vaseline" climbs the sloping rail of this steep overhang.

content.description: Start low in the wide crack with good feet, work your way out of the crack jamming and laybacking to the crux move to the lip.
content.location: When you approach The The Block walk left to the left of The Cock Block squeezing between that problem and a tree. when you get to the end of that wall turn right and follow the back dirty face to the end. Ahead of you will be a pit that has this roof crack running out of it.

content.description: Sit-start the steep overhang lip/ arete of the roof, climb up the arete to the apex and top out. Fun, friendly, dabby and awesome.
content.protection: No pads, too dabby, maybe a spot for the top but idk about that.
content.location:
This climb is found to the left of "Vaseline". It starts low on the roof lip and climbs up past the aesthetic "Vaseline" zig-zagging rail and shares the same topout.

 This climb is found on the boulder sitting on top of "Mr. Crawley", facing the trail.

content.description: This route is a very short right slanting crack. It is comprised of only a few moves, but it is a lot of fun. sit start at the base and make one hand move up the crack then pop to the top.
content.location: This route is located between Bobby's Problem and the boulder problems higher up on the trail, such as 603 special. This route is located on the left about 30 feet off the trail to Waimea.

content.description:
This is a fun steep overhanging problem that suffers from an awkward start. Once established on the wall it climbs well though.

 Start sitting on a small pedestal-like block under the overhang and figure out a way to pull on. The right hand starts low on a crimp and left hand slightly higher on another crimp. Pull on and make a few hard moves up crimps before tossing for some slopers on the lip. Don't punt the top.
content.location: This problem is found directly behind the problem "Ripping the Bull" found on The Block. It is the complete opposite side of the boulder as "The Block Problem".

content.description: This is a large boulder that stretches from the Block Area to the Entrance Boulders. There are several difficult and obscure lines found on this boulder and probably potential for another eight or so new problems.
